intro: Hieracium olympicum, commonly known as the Olympic hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe, particularly the Alps and the Pyrenees. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat, disc-like cluster. Hieracium olympicum is often found in meadows and open slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
